org.apache.log4j.spi

Interface RepositorySelector


  • public interface RepositorySelector
    The LogManager uses one (and only one) RepositorySelector implementation to select the LoggerRepository for a particular application context.

    It is the responsibility of the RepositorySelector implementation to track the application context. Log4j makes no assumptions about the application context or on its management.

    See also LogManager.

    Since:
    1.2

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      LoggerRepository getLoggerRepository()
      Returns a LoggerRepository depending on the context.

    • Method Detail

      • getLoggerRepository

        LoggerRepository getLoggerRepository()
        Returns a LoggerRepository depending on the context. Implementers must make sure that a valid (non-null) LoggerRepository is returned.
        Returns:
        a LoggerRepository.
